alert.note: Alert for Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine; Eastern Toole and Liberty; Hill County; Northern Blaine County; Western and Central Chouteau County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 09 at 2:56AM MDT until April 10 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: .Significantly warmer temperatures are expected through Monday with above average temperatures likely through Tuesday, resulting in melting of the lower elevation snowpack. This will increase the risk of flooding for low lying areas and areas with poor drainage. Above freezing temperatures during the overnight hours and mild afternoon temperatures will prolong the period of snow melt and subsequent runoff. Temperatures will trend cooler again toward mid week, but flooding concerns will continue through Tuesday before a cold front moves through. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt possible. * WHERE...A portion of north central Montana, including the following areas, Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine, Eastern Toole and Liberty, Hill County, Northern Blaine County and Western and Central Chouteau County. * WHEN...Through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations, especially on creeks and streams emanating from the Bears Paw mountains. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine; Eastern Toole and Liberty; Hill County; Northern Blaine County; Western and Central Chouteau County
